title: Legal Insights - Project Exam
description: This project represents a fully responsive and dynamic blog site, developed using core web technologies - HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The website's content, inclusive of 12 individual blog articles, is handled via WordPress functioning as a headless CMS. The project highlights proficiency in working with APIs (particularly, WordPress REST API), creating responsive designs, ensuring web accessibility, and implementing optimization strategies.

title: Community Science Museum - Semester Project
description: This project involved the development of an interactive website for a new local science museum, the Community Science Museum. The website was designed to be informative, appealing, and engaging. The website was developed using semantic HTML and external CSS, ensuring responsive and easy usability across various devices. The site included 6 pages, all optimized for quick downloads and SEO. WCAG principles were upheld to ensure accessibility.

title: Rainydays - School Project
description: Rainydays is a project designed as an outdoor jackets e-commerce platform for hiking and other activities. Developed with semantic HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, the website integrates a REST API from WordPress for product display and management. The site is built following WCAG principles for accessibility and uses responsive design techniques to ensure an optimal viewing experience across a range of devices.
